result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antero Mendez

records.addlTxt: dated 10-25-2022, filed by Atty. Andrew Herbers requesting an earlier plea and sentencing date or requesting to convert the previously scheduled hearing on 12-07-2022 to a plea and sentencing. **Reviewed by Judge Reilly - 12/7/22 date shall be converted to a plea/sentencing**

2:09 PM Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Antero Mendez.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appears by authorization. 
Defense is looking for an offer and is wondering who he should contact.
State advises the case has not been reassigned yet.
Defense requests a status hearing in about 30 days.
Hearing scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Authorization to appear received and filed.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty. Andy Herbers as counsel of record for the defendant.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster. Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim A (or their family) listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant is ordered to contact the Criminal Traffic Division within five (5) business days to make arrangements to sign their bond.  Failure to do so shall result in the Court issuing a bench warrant.

10:06 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Antero Mendez appeared by Zoom. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT. 
Defendant is ordered to contact the Criminal Traffic Division within five (5) business days to make arrangements to sign their bond.  Failure to do so shall result in the Court issuing a bench warrant.
Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Request to appear via zoom.
**Reviewed by Commissioner Christopher Bailey on 08-18-2022. "Granted"
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key. Signed by Judge Paul Reilly on 8/11/22

10:24 AM Defendant Antero Mendez not in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.

The Court notes that the Defendant wrote the court late yesterday and was present in Zoom.
The Court will adjourn the initial appearance.
Initial appearance scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on August 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
